title: Design for interoperability, not isolation
description: Structural bioinformatics tools rarely operate in isolation... (shortened ok)
imagine_if: Two tools exchange structure files without errors but interpret residue numbering differently...
questions: Does this tool use community-accepted structural formats and conventions?
Are residue, atom, chain, and ligand identifiers preserved consistently?
Would another tool interpret the output in the same way without custom fixes?
Are assumptions about data representation explicit and documented?
Could a mismatch produce plausible but incorrect results without raising errors?
